oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FIRST APPLICATIONS OF XBLOCPLUS: EXPERIENCES FROM AFSLUITDIJK AND VISTULA SPlT PROJECTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Koppel, Michael van de
Qian, Yang Zi
Bakker, Pieter
Bruins, Rolf
Swewczak, Tomasz
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: XblocPlus is a pattern placed single layer armour unit which was developed between 2015 and 2018 (Reedijk, 2018). The unit is applied on the Afsluitdijk Project in The Netherlands where 75,000 blocks are used. The second project followed at Vistula Spit in Poland. Valuable experiences were gained during the first practical application of the unit which are described in this paper.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 37 (2022): Proceedings of 37th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 2022; structures.79
